channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Media shows restraint on breaking news of Venezuela raid
item.description: The Trump administration has regularly vilified the mainstream media but not when it comes to the capture of Nicolas Maduro.
item.content:encoded: The Trump administration has regularly vilified the mainstream media but not when it comes to the capture of Nicolas Maduro.
item.dc:creator: David Folkenflik

item.title: Nicolás Maduro: A former bus driver and Chávez mentee who was overthrown by the U.S.
item.description: The rise and fall of a one-time Caracas bus driver to a mentee of the late Hugo Chávez to an autocrat overthrown and extracted by the United States.
item.content:encoded: The rise and fall of a one-time Caracas bus driver to a mentee of the late Hugo Chávez to an autocrat overthrown and extracted by the United States.
item.dc:creator: John Otis

item.title: Venezuela raid may have ripple effects in Mideast
item.description: Israel hopes the arrest of Maduro will be another pressure point on Iran and Hezbollah.
item.content:encoded: Israel hopes the arrest of Maduro will be another pressure point on Iran and Hezbollah.
item.dc:creator: Michele Kelemen

item.title: How another hospital patient helped saved a man
item.description: In 2013, John was chatting with another patient in the hospital when his words abruptly slurred. That patient recognized something was wrong and called for help, and doctors were able to intervene.
item.content:encoded: In 2013, John was chatting with another patient in the hospital when his words abruptly slurred. That patient recognized something was wrong and called for help, and doctors were able to intervene.

item.title: Democratic Gov. Tim Walz drops out of the race for Minnesota governor
item.description: Minnesota Democratic Gov. Tim Walz has decided to step out of the 2026 race for governor. He's clashed with Trump and been dogged by reports of fraud in state-run social services programs.
item.content:encoded: Minnesota Democratic Gov. Tim Walz has decided to step out of the 2026 race for governor. He's clashed with Trump and been dogged by reports of fraud in state-run social services programs.
item.dc:creator: Dana Ferguson

item.title: Maduro pleads not guilty to criminal charges in federal court
item.description: The now-deposed president of Venezuela, Nicolas Maduro, appears in court for the first time to face criminal charges in New York since his capture in a U.S. military operation.
item.content:encoded: The now-deposed president of Venezuela, Nicolas Maduro, appears in court for the first time to face criminal charges in New York since his capture in a U.S. military operation.
item.dc:creator: Jasmine Garsd

item.title: Was a little divine intervention at play in the Steelers' victory?
item.description: In a game that came down to the wire, did the Steelers have a bit of divine help in their faceoff against the Ravens?
item.content:encoded: In a game that came down to the wire, did the Steelers have a bit of divine help in their faceoff against the Ravens?
item.dc:creator: Tyler Bartlam

item.title: She experienced homelessness. Now she's helping people who don't have homes stay warm
item.description: Each year, Reno, Nev., has several months of below-freezing temperatures. A longtime advocate for homeless people in the city has established a warming center that offers a safe place to stay.
item.content:encoded: Each year, Reno, Nev., has several months of below-freezing temperatures. A longtime advocate for homeless people in the city has established a warming center that offers a safe place to stay.
item.dc:creator: Fil Corbitt

item.title: Taking a bow in your 90s: These nonagenarians get their big breaks on stage in NYC
item.description: Three women in their 90s are performing right now on New York stages, sometimes as often as eight performances a week.
item.content:encoded: Three women in their 90s are performing right now on New York stages, sometimes as often as eight performances a week.
item.dc:creator: Jeff Lunden

item.title: Kremlin condemns U.S. military operation in Venezuela
item.description: The U.S. essentially carried out the 'special military operation' that Russia planned for — and failed to accomplish — in Kyiv four years ago. Will this further embolden Russia?
item.content:encoded: The U.S. essentially carried out the 'special military operation' that Russia planned for — and failed to accomplish — in Kyiv four years ago. Will this further embolden Russia?
item.dc:creator: Charles Maynes
